params.text:
Improve type safety during operand fetching

Use fetch_object_of<>() to do it.

This requires that every type has the 'static const std::string type_name' attribute
that can be resolved to its generic type name at compile time.

More complex types (for higher-level languages) would be stored
in 'const std::string conrete_type_name' in each object?
I don't like to think that Viua would force type erasure like JVM does.
So maybe it should be:

- `generic_type_name`: e.g. `std::vector`
- `concrete_type_name`: e.g. `std::vector<int>`

This way all the information would be retained for runtime.
And since the VM needs the generic types (e.g. pointer, vector, etc.) the "generic" name
would be enough.

To sum up.
Two pieces of information are required for values: their generic type, and their concrete type.
